poem:
"Kensington Knock"

Shuffling through opulence, with a purpose in stride,
Work-worn fingers rap on, doors money can't hide. 
Deeds tied to power, with linens ironed crisp,
Frames of affluence, snapped, in the veteran's grip. 

Her age's tenacity, masked by winter's stoop,
Issues summons to the lords locked in the loop. 
'Sorry, none in', echoes the guard's refrain,
A lonely palace - Hodge's tour, in vain.
